page.title: 20 STREAMS IN HIGHCLIFFE
page.content: The{Walkford Brook}flows through Highcliffe and flows through a lovely valley called{Chewton Bunny.}The Chewton Bunny road bridge was made in 1901 and it was the first reinforced- concrete bridge in England. The sides of the Bunny are covered with woods and flowers. There are two or three paths in the Bunny and little wooden bridges cross the stream. You could go for a summer evening walk and you would see many rabbits and squirrels. {Bure Brook}starts from{Lakewood Lake and on its journey passes under six bridges and finishes at Mudeford. {Another stream}starts in Walkford and flows through Highcliffe to join Bure Brook in Nea Meadows. It flows under eight bridges and goes through Cobb's Carauan Park. By Caroline Wilkins, Rachael Shepherd Glynn Norvall and Colin White.
